page.title: 04Schools in Haltwhistle
page.content: The children have been educated in various parts of the town since 1719 when Lady Capel opened a school for the education of servant girls. A Board School was opened in 1872 and a Church of England school in 1876. This year a new First School was opened on 3rd April at a cost of three quarters of a million pounds. It has a well equipped Nursery School attached to it. Local people are very proud of their bright, well planned school. Sharing the same site is South Tynedale Middle School which was built in 1961 as a Secondary Modern school, but became a Middle school in 1974, catering for the 9 to 13 year olds in the district around Haltwhistle. The schools are on an elevated site, with views across to the fells, surrounded by well kept playing fields and with the local swimming pool near at hand.
